smell_analysis.justification: All provided pages contain valid diagram content.
All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are associated with at least one actor, either directly or via inclusion/generalization chains.
No redundant use case names associated with the same actor were found.
No distinct model elements with the same name were found within the same package context.
No obvious denormalization or redundant data storage without foreign keys was detected in the database diagrams.
Use case naming is consistent, using the verb-noun form (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Vaata kõiki autosid').
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, Lõpetatud) are reachable via transitions.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions are reachable through the decision flows.
All visible relationships on class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators or foreign key notations defined at both ends.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables.
No single class or table was found with 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page. The maximum observed was 5 connections on the 'Isik' class (Page 6).
The layout of the diagrams is balanced with no related elements placed excessively far apart.
All use cases and activity actions start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
All class, table, and attribute names exceed 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto' are 4 characters).
All class names are capitalized and singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Töötaja').

On the 'Isikute register' class diagram (Page 6), the class 'Isik' contains several attributes starting with an uppercase letter: 'E_meil', 'Eesnimi', 'Elukoht', 'Isikukood', 'Perenimi', and 'Sünni_kp'.
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Tootaja_roll').
No hungarian notation or type prefixes were found on class, table, or attribute names (excluding allowed key prefixes).
